content:
Tasks are not available for Google calendars unless they are configured to synchronize using the provider for google calendar add-on. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/provider-for-google-calendar/

The cal dav synchronization only synchronizes the calendar.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You might want to check on the menu bar that the View > messages > is set to all. and that the View > folders is not set to unread folders. (If you have no menu bar, pressing F10 will make it visible.)

This can also be set on a per folder basis as well, but you are saying all folders.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Basically, Thunderbird was stuck in filter mode of showing only "un-read" meassages. I could not find any setting that would correct the problem.

So I downloaded the latest install of Thunderbird.

So I exited out of Thunderbird. Downloaded the latest install of Thunderbird. I made screen prints and saved all the account info, and password info.

Turned off the WIFI, and copied the folder C:\users\LOGINNAME\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird to Documents\EmailBackup

Uninstalled Thunderbird C:\users\LOGINNAME\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird was still present, so I just renamed Thunderbird to JW_Thunderbird (JW because 1 year from now I will know I did it).

Installed a clean copy of Thunderbird, and connected to all the accounts, and everything worked again.

As I right this, I am thinking there may have been a setting in about:config, but who knows, it works now.

Cheers J
creator: jimwalker1960

content:
This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below:

More info: To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags 0=unthreaded

Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right. 

 ------------

To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: (I creates a crude video that walks through the steps. The video was created with table view for the message list pane. 

   https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4  that demonstrates the following steps: 
   First, highlight a folder that you have set to unthreaded	    In the Message List view, in the column header, on the far right, open the options button that shows         context menu. :    At the very bottom is the option:    -> "Apply current view to..."    -> "Folder and its children..."    -> Hover over an account    -> In the next menu don't select a folder. Instead select the account name itself.  ALSO, for future installations of Thunderbird,  - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.
creator: davidsk

When I selected the folder under all folders, the result was the same.

Thank you for your support in solving my problem.

content:
What are the IMAP or POP and SMTP setting your school publish that are to be used to connect a mail client?

BTW that is not them supporting Thunderbird. That is them doing their job advising you of their requirement for connection to their network. Funny how support desks appear to forget they dictate the settings you have to use, not the mail client. But many support desk folk these days are only trained in one product family. The ones they get an education discount to buy, so the next generation of graduates also know nothing else.

I would not be at all surprised if your EDU is using Microsoft exchange and they do not support any of the open source or published standards, only the proprietary ones from Microsoft. If that is the case you will need a paid addon. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/owl-for-exchange/

But ask them. With the right questions, so their support script can find the answer. Hopefully they will be a little more forthcoming with the required information.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thunderbird is only the go-between for you and your charter account. The only way to remove yourself from the charter account would be to create a new email account elsewhere, such as free ones (e.g., gmail or outlook), or fee-based ones (e.g., fastmail or protonmail) -- and there are others. I am not recommending one over another, just listing a few of which I am aware. Note: Thunderbird can work with all of these.
creator: davidsk
